title: Kinetics for the decomposition reaction of HI

content.description:
The decomposition of <math alttext="H l, gas" overflow="scroll"><mi>HI</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> into <math alttext="I 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is represented by the equation.

<math alttext="2 H l, gas reacts to produce I 2, gas plus H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>HI</mi> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi mathvariant="italic">g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math> 

The reaction is second order with respect to <math alttext="H I, gas" overflow="scroll"><mi>HI</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.
content.question:
Assuming all other conditions are held constant, which initial concentration of <math alttext="H l, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mi>HI</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> will result in an initial rate of formation of <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> that is <math alttext="16 " overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn></math> times higher than that in trial 1, as shown in the table?

Trial
 Initial <math alttext="molar concentration of H I" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><mi>HI</mi></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>
 Rate of Formation of <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

<math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>
 <math alttext="0.20 molar" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></math>
 <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>

<math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>
 <math alttext="question mark" overflow="scroll"><mo>?</mo></math>
 <math alttext="16 x " overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mi>x</mi></math>

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
